questions.question_text: Which is a purpose of the business case theme?

choices.C: Corporate, program management or the customer

discussion.content:
B; Why the other options are not correct:

A. The project manager: The project manager manages the project on a day-to-day basis, but they don't have the authority to appoint project board members.
C. Corporate, program management, or the customer: While these entities may have an interest in the project, the executive has the ultimate responsibility for appointing the senior user.
D. Project assurance: Project assurance provides independent oversight and advice, but they don't have the authority to appoint project board members.
Key takeaway: In a PRINCE2 project, the executive, as the chair of the project board, is responsible for appointing the senior user to ensure effective representation of user needs and benefits realization.

Which is a minimum requirement when applying the business case theme?

discussion.content:
C; Why the other options are not the minimum requirement:

A. To specify the solution to be used to deliver the business option selected: While important, this is more related to the project's solution and design, not the core of the Business Case theme.
B. To ensure the corporate business plan is updated with the project costs and benefits: This is good practice for alignment, but not the absolute minimum requirement for the Business Case theme itself.
D. To integrate the benefits management approach with the project and stage plans: This is important for benefits realization, but the minimum requirement focuses on defining the management actions.
Key takeaway: The Business Case theme in PRINCE2 requires a proactive approach to achieving outcomes and realizing benefits. Defining the necessary management actions is crucial for ensuring the project delivers true value to the organization.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct, check the manual.
The answer is C

C is correct, reference Prince2 guide 6.2

Minimum requirements

Your project must create and maintain a business justification (in the form of a business case), and you should review and update it throughout your project. You must define management actions to ensure the expected outcomes are achieved and the benefits are realized. You must define and document the roles and responsibilities for the business case and the management of benefits. Finally, you must produce and maintain a benefits management approach.
